intro: Riedelia alata, commonly known as the winged riedelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its stems, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Riedelia alata is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
